meanings.definition: To steal (something, especially something of small value); pilfer.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous raccoon filches shiny objects from the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The thief filches money from unsuspecting victims in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel filches nuts from the bird feeder every morning.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket filches wallets with lightning speed in crowded areas.
meanings.sent5: The cunning cat filches fish from the kitchen counter when no one is looking.

meanings.sent1: The greedy shopkeeper filches candies from the jar when no one is around.
meanings.sent2: The con artist filches personal information to commit identity theft.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy filches socks from the laundry basket and hides them in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The hacker filches sensitive data from online databases without leaving a trace.
meanings.sent5: The crafty magpie filches shiny trinkets to decorate its nest in the tree.
